column4: Tennessee
Answer1 Text

column2: 1. When you see this sign you should stop and:
column4: check traffic in all direction before proceeding.
column6: yield the right-of way to all vehicles coming from the left.
column8: check for vehicles in the opposite direction, then proceed.

column4: Merging traffic
Warning, crossroad ahead
if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column6: traffic from all four directions must stop.

column4: Lane reduction - the left lane ends soon
column8: Lane reduction - the right lane ends soon

column2: 6. On two-lane, two-way streets or highways, you should start left turns:
column4: close to the center line.

column2: 7. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.
column6: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.
column8: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.

column4: Road curves ahead
warns drivers to proceed with caution.
the road ahead is narrow.
column6: there is a one lane bridge ahead.

column4: take longer to stop than passenger vehicles.
column6: are more maneuverable than passenger vehicles.
column8: have high-tech air brakes which allow them to stop quickly.

column4: Anti-Locking Brake System
warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.
column6: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.
column8: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.

column4: No stopping
just before it rains.
column6: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 16. A traffic signal with a yellow left means:
column4: HOV lane is about to end.
column6: Prepare to yield to oncoming traffic.

column2: 17. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign:
column4: Always.

column2: 18. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Area reserved for people with disabilities
traffic must merge left.
column8: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.

column2: 20. Drivers may cross a double yellow line to pass another vehicle if:
column4: the yellow line next to the other side of the road is broken.
column6: the vehicle ahead moves to the right to let them pass.
column8: the yellow line next to their side of the road is broken.

column2: 21. When coming to an intersection with a yield sign, you should:
column4: yield the right-of-way to all traffic on the left.
column6: always come to a complete stop before entering the intersection.
column8: slow down and yield the right-of-way to other vehicles.

column2: 22. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.
column8: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.

column4: how far a vehicle will continue to travel before the driver hits the brakes.
column6: the total distance a vehicle has traveled until it comes to a complete stop.
column8: how far a vehicle will travel, in ideal conditions, while the driver is braking.

column2: 24. When changing lanes, you should remember that:
column4: vehicles with two outside mirrors have no blind spots.
column6: you should look over your left shoulder for a left lane change and your right shoulder for a right lane change.
column8: You only need to turn and look over your right shoulder for lane changes to the right or left.

column4: A school crossing
makes drivers more prone to take chances.

column2: 27. After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane when:
column4: the driver you passed slows down to let you return to your lane.
column6: you can see both headlights of the vehicle you just passed in your rearview mirror.
column8: you are at least 100 feet ahead of the vehicle you passed.

column2: 28. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
column4: minimum speed

column2: 29. When preparing to exit an expressway, drivers should start reducing their speed:
column4: about halfway through the deceleration lane.
column6: at least 100 feet before entering the deceleration lane.
column8: immediately upon entering the deceleration lane.

column2: 30. Tennessee law requires you to notify the Department of Safety of your address change within:
column4: 10 days.
